body_html:
FYI: core TensorFlow now has collective all-reduce and broadcast, though not yet part of the official API.

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/collective_ops.py

The strategic intention is that users should use the new distribution strategies framework to specify data-parallel distribution, and that framework will utilize collectives as appropriate.

https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/distribute/DistributionStrategy

The default implementation of collectives uses RPCs over gRPC so the performance is not great, compared to MPI/ib. However, MPI is not available everywhere. Going forward we plan to investigate introducing an API that makes it possible to link in MPI collectives where available and get platform-customized implementations, e.g. for a supercomputer.
